task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 157°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade/roofline of the building directly ahead to estimate its height accurately, so I will tilt the camera up.
The view is now pointed north/up and not at the target building to the south, so I must rotate to face south while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
To estimate the building height I need to see the top/roof against the sky, so I will tilt upward while staying pointed south.
The camera jumped back to north/up again, so I need to reorient to the south toward the target building before estimating its height.
I should keep facing south and look slightly up to include the full building height (roofline) in view for estimation.
The view is again north/up; to evaluate the building to the south I must rotate back to south while keeping this pitch to see the roof.
To complete the task I need the building's top in view, so I will look up while remaining oriented south.
Since I'm facing north/up again, I should rotate 180° to face the south building and then provide the height estimate.
I have enough orientation toward the building and can estimate its height as a typical 2–3 story structure, so I'll stop with an approximate value.
